title.narrative: Denmark’s contribution to the Special Fund of the Optional Protocol to the Convention against Torture (OPCAT) 2020 -2021

description.narrative:
The Special Fund for OPCAT is a unique mechanism of torture prevention and the only operational fund established by an international human rights treaty. Its support to national preventive mechanisms, the establishment of which is a core obligation under the Optional Protocol to the Convention against Torture is key in preventing torture at the national level.
The main objective of the development cooperation is effective prevention of torture through supporting projects contributing to the establishment or strengthening of NPMs in developing countries, including Benin, Mauritania, Mali, Niger, Senegal and Togo, in accordance with OPCAT and recommendations of the SPT or through the support of their education programmes.

title.narrative: Torture more effectively prevented in the States parties to OPCAT

Baseline 2019: A need to establish or strengthen NPMs in the States Parties to OPCAT, especially in developing countries, taking into account eligibility criteria of the OPCAT Special Fund.
Result 2020-2021: At least 15 NPMs established or strengthened via 25 OPCAT Special Fund supported projects in developing countries, including Benin, Mauritania, Mali, Niger, Senegal and Togo, in accordance with OPCAT and recommendations of the SPT or through the support of their education programmes.
